quarks.runtime.etiao

Class Executable

  • java.lang.Object
    • quarks.runtime.etiao.Executable
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    RuntimeServices

    public class Executable
extends java.lang.Object
implements RuntimeServices
    Executes and provides runtime services to the executable graph elements (oplets and functions).

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Executable(java.lang.String name, ServiceContainer containerServices)
      Creates a new Executable for the specified job.
      Executable(java.lang.String name, ServiceContainer containerServices, java.util.concurrent.ThreadFactory threads)
      Creates a new Executable for the specified topology name, which uses the given thread factory to create new threads for oplet execution.

    • Method Summary

      Creates a new Invocation associated with the specified oplet.
      void close()
      Shuts down the user scheduler and thread factory, close all invocations, then shutdown the control scheduler.
      Job createJob(Graph graph, java.lang.String topologyName, java.lang.String jobName) 
      java.lang.Throwable getLastError() 
      java.util.concurrent.ScheduledExecutorService getScheduler()
      Returns the ScheduledExecutorService used for running executable graph elements.
      <T> T getService(java.lang.Class<T> serviceClass)
      Acts as a service provider for executable elements in the graph, first looking for a service specific to this job, and then one from the container.
      boolean hasActiveTasks()
      Check whether there are user tasks still active.

      Initializes the invocations.
      void start()

      • Executable

        public Executable(java.lang.String name,
                  ServiceContainer containerServices)
        Creates a new Executable for the specified job.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the executable
        containerServices - runtime services provided by the container

      • Executable

        public Executable(java.lang.String name,
                  ServiceContainer containerServices,
                  java.util.concurrent.ThreadFactory threads)
        Creates a new Executable for the specified topology name, which uses the given thread factory to create new threads for oplet execution.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the executable
        containerServices - runtime services provided by the container
        threads - thread factory for executing the oplets

    • Method Detail

      • getScheduler

        public java.util.concurrent.ScheduledExecutorService getScheduler()
        Returns the ScheduledExecutorService used for running executable graph elements.
        Returns:
        the scheduler

      • getService

        public <T> T getService(java.lang.Class<T> serviceClass)
        Acts as a service provider for executable elements in the graph, first looking for a service specific to this job, and then one from the container.
        Specified by:
        getService in interface RuntimeServices
        Parameters:
        serviceClass - Type of the service required.
        Returns:
        Service of type implementing serviceClass if the container this invocation runs in supports that service, otherwise null.

      • addOpletInvocation

        public <T extends Oplet<I,O>,I,O> Invocation<T,I,O> addOpletInvocation(T oplet,
                                                                       int inputs,
                                                                       int outputs)
        Creates a new Invocation associated with the specified oplet.
        Parameters:
        oplet - the oplet
        inputs - the invocation's inputs
        outputs - the invocation's outputs
        Returns:
        a new invocation for the given oplet

      • initialize

        public void initialize()
        Initializes the invocations.

      • start

        public void start()
        Starts all the invocations.

      • close

        public void close()
        Shuts down the user scheduler and thread factory, close all invocations, then shutdown the control scheduler.

      • hasActiveTasks

        public boolean hasActiveTasks()
        Check whether there are user tasks still active.
        Returns:
        true if at least a user task is still active.
